result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Kenneth Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Katie J. Christiansen   DF:  Matthew James Reinert did not appear. Case called at 4:07 a.m. Atty. Christiansen updates Court. Time was set for a motion hearing. Bail continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Motion hearing on August 24, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Samantha M. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

PTC on June 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on May 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

-Defendant to post $250.00 by Friday May 8, 2015.

-Defendant to be escorted by a Uniformed Officer to obtain his belongings.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Samantha M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Matthew James Reinert appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Defendant is on probation in Minnesota. Defendant would move in with his uncle Paul Hunder in Newport MN.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.   
*Case recalled at 2:10 p.m - Defendant does have the address where he will be living w/his mother.  Defendant can only post $250.00 by Friday.
